samples.question: Let us not look at any of the bullet points, but what kind of things would you describe in a hotel?
samples.transcript: So, you had spa, you talked about the restaurant, you talked about the interiors of the room.

samples.question: What other things could we describe in a hotel?

samples.question: Was it a particular type of facial that you got or a particular type of or we could talk about feelings like how did the massage or how did the the the food or the staff make you feel?
samples.transcript: Or you could have a story. So, for example, you talked about the local cabin crew who spoke Vietnamese.
samples.transcript_original: Or you could have a story. So, for example, you talked about the local cabin crew who spoke Vietnamese.

samples.question: Do you want to visit a different part of Vietnam or something like that?
samples.transcript: So we what we are doing is we are giving oursel lots and lots of different options so that we never run out of things to say. So whenever we get a part two question, we want to speak normally as much as possible, but when we run out of things to say, we can just look down.

samples.question: Any questions about that strategy?
samples.transcript: >> that is I would say I would have many option to speak on that topic. Now I realize it >> and and you will not be able to do this immediately. So you are going to go away and work on this. I would recommend doing maybe you know two or three times a day for a while until this strategy becomes second nature. So you are doing it as a habit. So like when we are tying our shoelaces, we do not think about tying our shoelaces. We just do it so many times. Or riding a bike. We do not think about riding a bike.

samples.question: So always listen to the question and think what do they want me to do?
samples.transcript: They always are giving you some kind of task in each question. So it could be compare two things or it could be talk about the past like for example what career did you want to do when you were a child or they might want to test can she talk about the future what career would you like to do in the future or they might ask about you know testing can you give your opinion what is your favorite this what is a popular so always think about what are they wanting me to do in this in this question and if you are not sure always say can you repeat the question or what do you mean by that instead of jumping in.

samples.question: So, for example, do you think staying in an expensive hotel is a waste of money?
samples.transcript: You might think it is a waste of money. Other people would think that it is a very good investment and it is worth the money.
samples.transcript_original: You might think it's a waste of money. Other people would think that it's a very good investment and it's worth the money.

samples.question: What do you usually do when you get up early?
samples.transcript: I usually start my day with some stretching exercises then followed by a healthy breakfast. After that I go through my schedule for the day.

samples.question: Do you get up early on weekends?

samples.question: How has technology made our life easier?

samples.question: Which invention do you think is the most useful at home?
samples.transcript: I believe the refrigerator is the most useful invention at home. It helps to keep food preserved for the longer time. without it storing perishable goods like dairy product fruits and vegetables would be quite difficult. Okay. So you consider this is one of the most useful invention at home. Yes. Okay.
